New Records: Evan Mobley scored 25 points and Donovan Mitchell had 21 points for the Cleveland Cavaliers. The Cavaliers achieved a 33-point victory margin. Caris LeVert scored 19 points, and Jarrett Allen had 14 points
Key Match Events: The Toronto Raptors made 19 turnovers, leading to 30 points for the Cleveland Cavaliers. Immanuel Quickley was injured with a right pelvic contusion and did not return
Pre-Game Insights: The Cleveland Cavaliers won their first game against the Toronto Raptors in five season openers. The Raptors had a disappointing start with Scottie Barnes struggling and former players Damon Stoudamire, T.J. Ford, and Jerome Williams returning
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at a sellout crowd of 19,800. The Cleveland Cavaliers' bench played a significant role. The Cavaliers started without Max Strus due to injury
